clinical_study.brief_title: Study Evaluating Duvelisib in Japanese Subjects With Relapsed or Refractory Lymphoma
clinical_study.official_title: An Open-Label, Single-Arm, Multicenter Phase 1 Study Evaluating the Safety and Pharmacokinetics of Duvelisib in Japanese Subjects With Relapsed or Refractory Lymphoma

brief_summary.textblock: This study seeks to evaluate the safety and pharmacokinetics of duvelisib in Japanese participants with relapsed or refractory lymphoma.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of participants reporting Treatment-emergent Adverse Events
primary_outcome.time_frame: Throughout the study for approximately 2 years
primary_outcome.description: The number of participants reporting treatment-emergent adverse events.

primary_outcome.measure: Maximum Observed Plasma Concentration (Cmax) of Duvelisib
primary_outcome.time_frame: Cycle 1 Day 1, 8, 15, and 22 and on Day 1 of Cycles 2 - 5

primary_outcome.measure: Time to Maximum Observed Concentration (Tmax) of Duvelisib
primary_outcome.time_frame: Cycle 1 Day 1, 8, 15, and 22 and on Day 1 of Cycles 2 - 5

primary_outcome.measure: Area Under the Plasma Concentration-time Curve (AUC) of Duvelisib
primary_outcome.time_frame: Cycle 1 Day 1, 8, 15, and 22 and on Day 1 of Cycles 2 - 5

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Throughout the study for approximately 2 years
secondary_outcome.description: Overall Response Rate is defined as the proportion of participants with a confirmed response of complete (CR) or partial response (PR) based on the revised International Working Group (IWG) criteria.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Throughout the study for approximately 2 years
secondary_outcome.description: Overall survival is defined as the duration in weeks from the date of the first dose of study treatment until the date of death.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Throughout the study for approximately 2 years
secondary_outcome.description: Progression free survival is defined as the time from the date of the first dose of study treatment to the first documentation of progressive disease (PD) or death due to any cause.

arm_group.description: Duvelisib will be administered orally as a fixed dose in 28-day cycles.

intervention.description: Duvelisib will be administered orally as a fixed dose in 28-day cycles.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Diagnosis of lymphoma (excluding lymphoblastic lymphoma)
- Progressed during, refractory to, intolerant of, or ineligible for established therapy, or has a disease for which there is no established therapy
- Eastern Cooperative Oncology Group (ECOG) performance status lower than or equal to 2
- Life expectancy of at least 3 months
Exclusion Criteria:
- Any prior treatment with a PI3K inhibitor or Bruton's tyrosine kinase (BTK) inhibitor
- Ongoing treatment with chronic immune-suppressants
- Overt CNS lymphoma
- Inadequate hepatic, bone marrow, or renal function
- History of stroke, unstable angina, myocardial infarction, or ventricular arrhythmia requiring medication or mechanical control within the last 6 months
- Venous thromboembolic event requiring anticoagulation
- Presence of active systemic infection within 72 hours of treatment
- Human immunodeficiency virus (HIV) infection
- Pregnant or lactating women
